alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Randolph County through 330 PM CDT... At 240 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fosters Cross Roads, or 8 miles northwest of Wedowee, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wedowee, Lake Wedowee, Woodland, Morrison Cross Roads, Fosters Cross Roads, Corinth, Tennant and Ofelia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
